pros: Good hours to work, work is easy
cons: don't have any at this time

pros: Great patients and some good coworkers.
cons: According to HR and the supervisor over the behavior health unit they are ok with fostering an environment of nurses eating their young. They are ok with bullies and nurses sleeping at night. They have terrible night time supervisors. They do not care about employees who are dealing with life threatening illnesses and do not provide proper accommodations. I hope that one day they do not have to deal with an autoimmune disease that messes up their body’s ability to process anything. They do not take complaints seriously and take up for those who are in the wrong and manipulate every situation. The pay is terrible and insurance sucks. They also will say anything to get you hired and then change everything once they think they have you.

pros: small and everyone knows you. they are kind and friendly. small town feeling. no long lines except in ER but it is like that anywhere from time to time
